title: Trump's brute force will not drive China out of Latin America
subhead: Trade has become the main vehicle of Chinese power, and the deep dependencies already created weigh more heavily than the threat of diplomatic, or even military, pressure wielded by the US.

title: Fed chair Powell says he is under federal investigation
EU-Mercosur deal: Brazil, the agricultural superpower that feeds the world
Far right continues to gain ground in French public opinion
subhead: France is divided, with half the population anxious about the rise of the Rassemblement National, and half enthusiastic about the solutions it claims to offer, according to an annual survey conducted by the Verian institute for Le Monde.

title: Californian billionaires flee potential one-off 5% wealth tax
subhead: In 2024, California had 255 billionaires, more than any other state. A state ballot initiative aimed at taxing the state's wealthiest residents could be put to a public vote in autumn 2026.

title: 2026 Golden Globes: 'One Battle After Another' sweeps Best Film, Best Director and Best Screenplay
subhead: Paul Thomas Anderson's screwball thriller entered the night with nine nominations. Anderson won Best Director, while Teyanna Taylor snagged Best Supporting Female. The film's only major upset was its star Leonardo DiCaprio losing best actor to Timothée Chalamet for 'Marty Supreme.'

title: The British seniors trading tea dances at a daring cabaret
subhead: Once a month at London's The Posh Club, burlesque acts and striptease in a nightclub atmosphere delight Brits over 60, who let loose until late in the afternoon.

title: Danish PM says Greenland showdown at 'decisive moment' after new Trump threats

RN voters prefer Bardella over Le Pen, according to poll
subhead: The victimization strategy that Marine Le Pen, head of the far-right Rassemblement National party, adopted after her embezzlement conviction has failed to reach beyond her core base. Her party's voters see Jordan Bardella as more capable of leading France.

title: 'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
subhead: Europe finds itself in a perilous phase, having recognized its solitude but lacking the means for true autonomy, while the emotion created by the aggressiveness of empires calls for a response, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhead: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

title: By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
'A spirit of reconquest has taken hold in Washington, particularly driven by Secretary of State Marco Rubio'
